thread.title: Gov. Brown Seeks $437 Million For Flood Control, Emergency Response
thread.title_full: Gov. Brown Seeks $437 Million For Flood Control, Emergency Response

author: CBS San Francisco
title: Gov. Brown Seeks $437 Million For Flood Control, Emergency Response
text:
Gov. Brown Seeks $437 Million For Flood Control, Emergency Response February 24, 2017 12:25 PM Filed Under: California , flood control , Gov. Jerry Brown Floodwaters surround homes and cars on February 22, 2017, in San Jose (CBS). 
SACRAMENTO (AP) â€” California Gov. Jerry Brown wants to spend $437 million on flood control and emergency response in the water-logged state. 
Brown said Friday he would do that by redirecting $50 million from the state general fund and requesting a $387 million appropriation from the voter-approved 2014 Proposition 1 water bond. 
Both actions require approval by the state Legislature, and Brown is asking that it be done as soon as possible. 
Brown also is seeking updates on flood inundation maps and emergency action plans as well as enhanced dam inspections. 
The governor says that overall the state has $187 billion in unmet infrastructure needs.
